remarks: Relative complements of the finite parts of an infinite set is a filter.  When ` A = NN ` the set of the relative complements is called Frechet's filter and is used to define the concept of limit of a sequence.  (Contributed by FL, 14-Jul-2008.)  (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 2-Aug-2015.)
statement:
cfinfil $p |- ( ( X e. V /\ A C_ X /\ -. A e. Fin ) -> { x e. ~P X | ( A \ x ) e. Fin } e. ( Fil ` X ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d X x $.
